meanings.definition: The act of apportioning again or differently.
meanings.sent1: After the census, the state had to make reapportionments of voting districts.
meanings.sent2: The reapportionments of seats in the parliament were based on population changes.
meanings.sent3: The reapportionments of candy in the jar caused a heated debate among the kids.
meanings.sent4: The reapportionments of tasks among the team members made the project run smoother.
meanings.sent5: Her method of reapportionments of study time helped her ace the exam.

meanings.definition: The redistribution of representation in a legislative body.
meanings.sent1: The reapportionments of seats in the senate were a topic of discussion.
meanings.sent2: Reapportionments in the congress can impact the balance of power.
meanings.sent3: The reapportionments of pizza slices at the party caused some to be unhappy.
meanings.sent4: The reapportionments of roles in the play gave everyone a chance to shine.
meanings.sent5: The reapportionments of toys among the children led to some negotiations.
